profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T19:20-0400

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This small, unprocessed collection contains a variety of printed ephemera, including circulars, clippings, fliers, newsletters, typescripts, etc. Many are of a humorous and or satirical nature. The principal themes are expression of opposition to the Vietnam War, and advocacy of greater rights, in particular freedom of speech, for students at the high school. There are also several photographs of a student demonstration and what appears to be a "teach-in."

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Reiss was a student rights and peace (anti- Vietnam War) activist at Seward Part High School on New York City's Lower East Side in the late 1960s and early 1970s.

controlaccess.corpname: Seward Park High School (New York, N.Y.).
